Shenzhen NTEK New Energy Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter called the "NTEK New Energy"), founded on 6 August 2018, it is a subsidiary corporation of the NTEK Group (hereinafter called the "NTEK" which dedicated in new energy industry to deliver total solution for battery quality and safety, it was also originally founded under NTEK in 2012 and operated as an independent new energy business unit.
NTEK is a pioneer in third-party testing and certification services in China, which equipped with advanced laboratories covering new energy batteries, electromagnetic compatibility (MC), radio frequency (RF), electrical safety, energy efficiency and energy saving, physical and chemical analysis (electrical and electronic prohibited substances, toys and infants Children's products, clothing textiles, leather and shoes materials, accessories and bags), food contact materials, environmental testing,
NTEK is integrating R&D, innovation, and service, and committed to building a safe, environmentally friendly, and healthy harmonious society, and strive to become the most trusted quality technical service organization in inspection, identification, testing and certification fields.
The NTEK New Energy, based on NTEK's all-round comprehensive testing service platform, relied on its long-term and highly innovative technology accumulation and experience, with safety for batteries as its mission, committed to provide high-end testing and certification services for batteries and battery-powered products, and deeply cooperates with global top international certification bodies, so that builds most valuable international battery testing and certification service platform for the world.
The NTEK New Energy truly takes testing technology or techniques as the core value, keeps to focus on, explores and promotes the sustainable development of global battery and its end-product industry, utilizes cutting-edge laboratories, testing equipment, professional knowledge and innovative technology, with a reliable rigorous attitude and cutting-edge Efficient solutions to empower the sustainable development of lithium batteries and its end-product manufacturers, helps them to transform the concepts of safety, health, green, and sustainable development into real market leadership to lead the healthy and steady development of the lithium battery industry.
"Do business all over the world with partners. Ensure excellent quality, then achieve gorgeous development in the future.' The NTEK New Energy promises to strictly abide by operating procedures, implement inspection and testing standards, keep the principles of objective, impartial and truthful, observe professional ethics, assume social responsibilities, and consistently contribute to the global lithium battery, electric scooter, electric bicycle and other battery-powered product industries with unparalleled quality and safety certification services.

Shenzhen NTEK New Energy Technology Co., Ltd. (hereinafter called the "NTEK New Energy"), founded on 6 August 2018, it is a subsidiary corporation of the NTEK Group (hereinafter called the "NTEK" which dedicated in new energy industry to deliver total solution for battery quality and safety, it was also originally founded under NTEK in 2012 and operated as an independent new energy business unit.
NTEK is a pioneer in third-party testing and certification services in China, which equipped with advanced laboratories covering new energy batteries, electromagnetic compatibility (MC), radio frequency (RF), electrical safety, energy efficiency and energy saving, physical and chemical analysis (electrical and electronic prohibited substances, toys and infants Children's products, clothing textiles, leather and shoes materials, accessories and bags), food contact materials, environmental testing,
NTEK is integrating R&D, innovation, and service, and committed to building a safe, environmentally friendly, and healthy harmonious society, and strive to become the most trusted quality technical service organization in inspection, identification, testing and certification fields.
The NTEK New Energy, based on NTEK's all-round comprehensive testing service platform, relied on its long-term and highly innovative technology accumulation and experience, with safety for batteries as its mission, committed to provide high-end testing and certification services for batteries and battery-powered products, and deeply cooperates with global top international certification bodies, so that builds most valuable international battery testing and certification service platform for the world.
The NTEK New Energy truly takes testing technology or techniques as the core value, keeps to focus on, explores and promotes the sustainable development of global battery and its end-product industry, utilizes cutting-edge laboratories, testing equipment, professional knowledge and innovative technology, with a reliable rigorous attitude and cutting-edge Efficient solutions to empower the sustainable development of lithium batteries and its end-product manufacturers, helps them to transform the concepts of safety, health, green, and sustainable development into real market leadership to lead the healthy and steady development of the lithium battery industry.
"Do business all over the world with partners. Ensure excellent quality, then achieve gorgeous development in the future.' The NTEK New Energy promises to strictly abide by operating procedures, implement inspection and testing standards, keep the principles of objective, impartial and truthful, observe professional ethics, assume social responsibilities, and consistently contribute to the global lithium battery, electric scooter, electric bicycle and other battery-powered product industries with unparalleled quality and safety certification services.

MicoinvertersTiger Series Microinverters 600w-2kw
TENTEK Tiger series microinverters are on/off-grid inverters when working with our Tribune-EMS series controller, it  magically creates a residential solar storage system that supports battery mode operation without main power. In addition, the independent MPPT input ensures the MAX output of each solar panel. Since the 25-year lifespan of microinverter is designed to be the same as the solar panel, customers do not need to be worried about the hassle of replacing the inverter after a few years.
●    Can work in off-grid, with ups and storage function
●    Automatic power distribution( automatically distribute the power to loads, charge batteries,
and the grid )
●    Solar panels output voltage <60VDC, decrease the risk of the electric fire.
●    One-panel match one MPPT, increase 5-15% electricity production verse string inverters.
●    Keep each panel working individually, avoid the impact of partial shadows .
●    Independently tracking each solar panel’s production, easy to identify each
solar panel’s performance.
●    Flexible application function, could be switched to off-grid mode to supply AC power
to home devices.
●    Lightweight and compact with plug-and-play connectors, easy to install.
●    Flexibly monitor your solar harvest via the APP
TENTEK Intelligent EMS Controller
Tribune-EMS
1.6-4.8KW EMS Controller
TENTEK Tribune series energy controller has a powerful and advanced system that integrates (MPPT+AC) battery charger and energy management function for on/off-grid PV system with MAX 4.8KW power output. It works with our Tiger series microinverters and magically creates a residential solar storage system that supports battery mode operation without main power.
Furthermore, the adaptive function of the wide voltage battery enables customers to choose batteries in different voltage: (12V/24V/36V/48V), and different types: (Lead-acid batteries, lithium batteries, or others). The shell is designed with high-performance aluminum alloy to die-casting sealing so that it can keep running in the harsh natural environment.
●   Create a residential solar storage system
●   4 Independent trackers, maximize each solar panel output
●   Automatic battery voltage detection in 12V/24V/46V/48V
●   Suitable for different battery types
●   MPPT tracking efficiency >99.9%, Peak conversion efficiency >99%
●   With the UPS function, keep your home devices running
●   6 LED lights clearly show all work status
●   Reverse polarity protection of solar panel and battery
●   Overcharge and overload protection
●   Flexibly monitor your solar harvest via the APP

How to boost your solar power system with solar optimization?
If you have a solar power system or are planning to install one, you might be wondering how to get the most power out of it. One way to enhance the performance and efficiency of your solar system is to use solar optimization devices. These devices can help you overcome the challenges of shading, mismatch,  different orientation, and aging that can reduce the output of your solar panels.
In this article, we will explain what solar optimization is, how it works, and what types of solar optimization devices are available. We will also help you decide whether you need solar optimization for your solar system and how to choose the best option for your needs.
What is Solar Optimization?
Solar optimization is the process of maximizing the power output of each solar panel in a solar system. Solar optimization devices are also known as module-level power electronics (MLPEs), which are attached to each solar panel to optimize their performance individually.
Solar optimization devices use a technology called maximum power point tracking (MPPT) to adjust the voltage and current of each solar panel according to the environmental conditions and the characteristics of the panel. This way, each panel can produce the maximum amount of power possible, regardless of the performance of the other panels in the system.
Why Do You Need Solar Optimization?
Solar optimization not only can help you increase the energy output and the lifespan of your solar system but also can also help you monitor and maintain your solar system more easily and effectively.
Here are some of the benefits of solar optimization:
· Less Shading Issues
Shading is one of the main factors that can lower the output of your solar system. Shading can occur due to trees, buildings, clouds, dust, or dirt on your solar panels. When a part of a solar panel is shaded, it creates a bottleneck that reduces the current flow of the whole panel and the whole string of panels connected to it,  which could significantly decrease the power output of your solar system. Solar optimization devices can bypass the shaded parts of the panels and allow the unshaded parts to operate normally, minimizing the power losses due to shading.
· Eliminate Panel Mismatch
Mismatch is another factor that can affect the output of your solar system. Mismatch occurs when the electrical parameters of the solar panels in a system are different due to manufacturing variations, aging, degradation, or damage. When the panels in a system have different voltages or currents, they cannot operate at their optimal points, resulting in power losses. Solar optimization devices can match the voltage and current of each panel to their optimal points, reducing the power losses due to mismatch.
· Extend Solar System's Lifespan
Solar optimization devices can protect your solar system from potential damages caused by hot spots, reverse currents, or overvoltage. Hot spots are areas of high temperature on the solar panels that can occur due to shading, mismatch, or poor ventilation. Hot spots can degrade the performance and the lifespan of the panels. Reverse currents are currents that flow in the opposite direction of the normal current flow, which can happen when a panel is shaded or damaged. Reverse currents can cause overheating and fire hazards. Overvoltages are voltages that exceed the maximum voltage rating of the solar system, which can happen due to lightning strikes, grid fluctuations, or faulty wiring. Overvoltages can damage the solar panels, the inverters, or the electrical appliances. Solar optimization devices can prevent or mitigate these issues by regulating the voltage and current of each panel, enhancing the safety and the durability of your solar system.
· Monitor and Maintenance
Solar optimization devices can provide you with real-time data and alerts on the performance and the status of each panel in your solar system. You can access this information through a web portal or a mobile app, and use it to troubleshoot any problems, optimize your energy consumption, or plan your maintenance schedule. Solar optimization devices can also enable remote control and firmware updates for your solar system, making it easier and more convenient to manage your solar system.
What Types of Solar Optimization Devices are There?
There are four main types of solar optimization devices:
1. Discrete DC optimizers
2. Smart panels
3. Maxim panels
4. Microinverters
Let's take a look at each type and how they differ from each other:
1. Discrete DC optimizers
Discrete DC optimizers are separate devices that are attached to each solar panel in a system. They optimize the voltage and current of each panel before sending it to a central inverter, which converts the DC power to AC power for the grid or the load. Discrete DC optimizers are compatible with most solar panels and inverters, and they can be installed on some or all of the panels in a system, depending on the shading or mismatch conditions. Discrete DC optimizers are the second most expensive option for solar optimization, after microinverters. One of the leading manufacturers of discrete DC optimizers is Tigo, which offers a range of products and solutions for different applications and budgets.
2. Smart panels
Smart panels are solar panels that have integrated DC optimizers built into them. They work in the same way as discrete DC optimizers, but they are more convenient and cost-effective, as they eliminate the need for separate devices and wiring. However, smart panels require that all of the panels in a system have optimizers, which may not be necessary or desirable for some situations. Smart panels are also compatible with most inverters, and they can be mixed and matched with different brands and models of solar panels. Many of the smart panels on the market are the result of collaborations between Tigo and other module manufacturers, such as Jinko Solar, Canadian Solar, and Trina Solar.
3. Maxim panels
Maxim panels are solar panels that have microchip optimizers embedded in them. They optimize the voltage and current of each cell string in a panel, rather than the whole panel. They also bypass the shaded or mismatched cell strings, rather than boosting them, which reduces the voltage drop and the power losses. Maxim panels are the cheapest option for solar optimization, as they use simpler and smaller devices than DC optimizers or microinverters. However, Maxim panels are not very popular or widely available, as they have been phased out by some of the module manufacturers that used to offer them, such as Jinko Solar, Suntech, and ET Solar.
4. Microinverters
Microinverters are mini inverters that are attached to each solar panel in a system. They optimize and convert the voltage and current of each panel from DC to AC at the panel level, rather than at the system level. This eliminates the need for a central inverter, and allows each panel to operate independently from the rest of the system. Microinverters are the most expensive option for solar optimization, but they also offer the highest performance and safety benefits. Microinverters are also easy to install and expand, as they do not require complex wiring or configuration. One of the leading manufacturers of microinverters is Enphase, which offers a comprehensive and integrated solution for solar optimization, monitoring, and management.
What about Bypass Diodes?
Bypass diodes are devices that are used to prevent power loss and damage in solar panels due to shading or faulty cells. They are connected in parallel with the solar cells or panels, but with opposite polarity, so that they only conduct current when the cell or panel is reverse biased. This allows the current to flow around the underperforming or faulty section, rather than through it, and reduces the voltage drop and heat generation.
However, Bypass diodes don't optimize solar panels individually. Also they will be deactivated when there’s significant shading because the voltage is too low, which could cause the entire system to shut off.
How to Choose the Best Solar Optimization Device for Your Needs?
The best solar optimization device for your needs will depend on several factors, such as:
· Budget
· Shading Situation
· Your Safety Concerns
· System Size and Configuration
· Monitoring and Maintenance Preferences
Here are some general guidelines to help you choose the best solar optimization device for your needs:
· If you have a low budget and minimal shading, you may not need solar optimization at all, or you may opt for the cheapest option, which is Maxim panels, if you can still find them.
· If you have a moderate budget and moderate shading, you may choose the most cost-effective option, which is smart panels(intergrated solar optimizer), or you may choose discrete DC optimizers, if you only want to optimize some of the panels in your system.
· If you have a high budget and high shading, you may choose the most advanced option, which is microinverters, or you may choose discrete DC optimizers, if you want to have more flexibility and compatibility with your system components.
· If you have a high concern for safety, you may choose microinvertersor DC optimizers with shut down function, as they reduce the risk of fire and electric shock by lowering the voltage on your roof and isolating the faults in your system.
· If you have a small or simple system, you may choose any of the options, as they will not make much difference in terms of installation and performance.
· If you have a large or complex system, you may choose microinverters, as they will make it easier to install and expand your system, and they will also provide more consistent and reliable performance across your system.
· If you have a high interest in monitoring and maintaining your system, you may choose any of the options, as they will all provide you with panel-level data and alerts, and some of them will also allow you to control and update your system remotely.
Conclusion
Solar optimization is a way to improve the performance and efficiency of your solar system by maximizing the power output of each solar panel. Solar optimization devices are also known as module-level power electronics (MLPEs), which are attached to each solar panel to optimize their voltage and current. Solar optimization devices can help you overcome the challenges of shading, mismatch, and aging that can reduce the output of your solar system. Solar optimization devices can also help you monitor and maintain your solar system more easily and effectively.
There are four main types of solar optimization devices: discrete DC optimizers, smart panels, Maxim panels, and microinverters. They differ in terms of cost, convenience, compatibility, and performance. The best solar optimization device for your needs will depend on your budget, your shading situation, your safety concerns, your system size and configuration, and your monitoring and maintenance preferences.

The Advantages of Photovoltaic Optimizer's
If you want to get more power from your solar panels, you may have heard of Solar Optimizer or Photovoltaic Optimizer. These are devices that can improve the performance and efficiency of your photovoltaic system by optimizing the output of each panel. But what are they exactly, and how do they work? In this article, we will reveal the secret of Photovoltaic Optimizer's advantages and show you how they can benefit your solar installation.
What is a photovoltaic optimizer?
A photovoltaic optimizer is a device that adjusts the DC characteristics of each solar panel to optimize its energy output. It is ideal for situations where shading or multiple orientations are present, as it can mitigate the power loss caused by these factors. A photovoltaic optimizer can track the maximum power point (MPP) of each panel in real time and adjust the voltage and current accordingly. This way, each panel can work in its optimal condition and produce the maximum amount of power possible.
A photovoltaic optimizer is different from a micro inverter, which converts the DC power from each panel to AC power. A photovoltaic optimizer works with a central inverter, which converts the DC power from the whole string of panels to AC power. This means that a photovoltaic optimizer can reduce the DC losses and increase the AC efficiency of the system.
Key Benefits of Photovoltaic Optimizer
There are many benefits of using a photovoltaic optimizer for your solar system, such as:
· Increase the power generation of your system by 5% to 25%, depending on the shading and mismatch conditions of your panels.
· Reduce the operation and maintenance costs of your system by accurately locating the problem points and improving the operation and maintenance efficiency of the power station.
· Reduce the safety risks of your system by achieving component-level shutdown and preventing electric arcs from forming in the connectors.
· Monitor the performance of each panel and get real-time alerts and notifications of any issues or faults.
How to install a photovoltaic optimizer?
A photovoltaic optimizer is usually installed on each solar panel (some models can connect to two modules), as shown in the following figure:
The topology diagram of a photovoltaic optimizer system is shown in the following figure:
As you can see, a photovoltaic optimizer system consists of three main components: the power optimizer, the inverter, and the monitoring platform (data processing device, data receiver, and data cloud center). The power optimizers are connected to each panel and optimize their output. The inverter is connected to the power optimizers and converts the DC power to AC power. The monitoring platform is connected to the inverter, collects the data from each power optimizer, and displays it on a web or mobile app.
How to I choose a photovoltaic optimizer?
There are different types and models of photovoltaic optimizers available on the market, and you need to choose the one that suits your needs and preferences. Here are some factors to consider when choosing a photovoltaic optimizer:
· The input power and voltage of your panels.
You need to choose a power optimizer that can support the input power and voltage of your panels. For example, if you have panels with 800Wp input power, you need to choose a power optimizer that can handle 800Wp+ input power and the input voltage, such as Honeybee 850.
· The features and functions of the power optimizer.
You need to choose a power optimizer that has the features and functions that you need. For example, the advanced safety features, simplified wiring, and smart remote monitoring,
· The compatibility and warranty of the power optimizer.
You need to choose a power optimizer that is compatible with your panels, inverter, and monitoring platform. You also need to check the warranty and service terms of the power optimizer and choose a reliable and reputable brand that can provide you with quality products and support.
A photovoltaic optimizer is a device that can optimize the output of each solar panel and increase the power generation and efficiency of your photovoltaic system. It can also reduce operation and maintenance costs, decrease safety risks, and monitor the performance of each panel. If you want to get the most out of your solar panels, you should consider installing a photovoltaic optimizer for your system. You can choose from different types and models of photovoltaic optimizers, depending on your needs and preferences. You can also consult with a professional solar installer or provider to help you choose and install the best photovoltaic optimizer for your system.

results.raw_content:
Stack Infrastructure announces 216MW campus in Ashburn, Virginia
Stack goes big in Virginia
Stack Infrastructure has announced a new 216MW data center campus in Ashburn, Virginia.
The company announced this week a new 80-acre campus that will support three buildings totaling almost 1 million sq ft.
The first phase for the Ashburn campus is due to come online in Q3 of 2023. Stack said the new facilities will be powered by 100 percent renewable energy provided by Dominion.
“Stack’s forward development in the most challenging markets is our differentiator. Our clients seek speed, scale, quality, and partnership. This new flagship campus exemplifies that,” said Brian Cox, Stack CEO. “I am proud that our development team was able to deploy its expertise while building strong relationships to deliver the on-demand capacity, in key locations, that top technology innovators need.”
According to DgtlInfra, the NVAL2 data center development project is located at 22285 Lockridge Road in Sterling, on the border of Ashburn. The land was (or possibly still is) owned by SDC Ashburn I LLC, itself owned by SDC Capital Partners; The land is also connected to SDC’s Sentinel Data Centers. Whether Stack and/or its owners IPI Partners have bought the land or are leasing the site on a long-term basis is unclear.
The news comes after Stack broke ground on a new facility on its other Northern Virginia campus in Manassas, Prince William County, in October. The development is the second phase of expansion and will bring an additional 36MW of critical capacity that will eventually reach 72MW and come online starting in Q4 2022.
“Stack’s development team continues to leverage its relationships with utilities, local authorities, and developer partners to establish a strong, scalable presence in critical markets like Northern Virginia, despite land and power scarcity,” added Tim Hughes, Vice President of Strategy and Development at Stack. “Dedication to our clients has driven Stack to secure campus-scale sites and electrical interconnections to allow hyperscalers and enterprises continuous expansion in key markets.”
2021 saw Stack open a data center in San Jose, California, and announce plans for the facility in Toronto, Canada. It has also opened an office in Singapore in order to expand into the Asia Pacific market. The company raised $400 million via securitized notes and is also planning a 24MW facility in Portland, Oregon.

results.raw_content:
NTT Global Data Centers Plans Massive New Campus in Northern Virginia
NTT Global Data Centers is expanding its presence in Northern Virginia with a massive new campus in Prince William County, the company said today. NTT has acquired property from Lerner Enterprises in Gainesville, Va. where it plans to develop 2 million square feet of data center space, supporting 336 megawatts (MWs) of capacity.
The 103-acre campus will provide room for long-term growth for NTT and its customers in Northern Virginia, where the company already operates a major campus in “Data Center Alley” in Ashburn, the primary cloud hub in Loudoun County.
NTT says the Gainesville project will become its single largest campus, with plans for four two-story data center buildings, with the first scheduled to come online in the second quarter of 2024.  The design will also offer “dedicated self-contained areas for large-footprint deployments” to support hyperscale clients.
“The development of a new data center campus in Virginia is testament to our huge growth and momentum across North America” said Doug Adams, President and CEO at NTT Global Data Centers Americas. “This strategic purchase of land is just one of the many steps we’re taking to accelerate our data center footprint across the country.”
NTT Global Data Centers Americas is in the midst of a major expansion, with construction projects underway across the U.S. to add more capacity. The company has spent the past two years entering new markets, opening data center campuses in Hillsboro, Chicago, Santa Clara and Phoenix.
“The development of our new campus in Virginia will be one of 14 ongoing projects taking place across the globe,” said Masaaki Moribayashi, President and Board Director, NTT Ltd. “By 2025, it is estimated that 95% of new digital workloads will be deployed on cloud-native platforms, up from 30% in 2021. As a result, the demand for data centers to support this shift has never been higher. As one of the largest data center providers in the world, NTT is well placed to support this reliance, and we’re focused on supporting our customers as their needs continue to change,”
Data Center Developers Look Beyond Ashburn
Northern Virginia has become the global capital for cloud computing, and is home to hundreds of data centers. That includes many hyperscale facilities operated by Amazon Web Services, Google, Microsoft and Meta, as well as data center developers who support their growth.
Data center development in Prince William County has accelerated in recent years as development parcels grow scarce near the regional data center hub in Ashburn in Loudoun County. There is now a growing cloud cluster near Manassas, and land speculation from developers has boosted property values, with recent transactions valuing data center development sites at nearly $1 million an acre.
There is now an estimated 5.3 million square feet of data center space in Prince William County, with another 8 million to 10 million square feet in the development pipeline, according to a recent report.
The NTT project is part of a data center building boom in Gainesville around the intersection of Route 66 and 29 (Lee Highway). The NTT property is across the highway from Gainesville Crossing, a large campus from Corscale that will feature 2.3 million square feet of data center space and 306MW of utility power.
Both projects are west of the proposed Prince William Digital Gateway, which could add millions of addition square feet of data centers and has generated lively debate about the appropriate location for future development in the county.
NTT Accelerates Global Data Center Expansion
The Gainesville campus is part of an ongoing global expansion for NTT, which plans to increase its data center footprint to more than 1,000 MWs in 20 countries by the end of 2022. NTT says its data centers in Prince William will be sustainable, as part of the company’s commitment to achieving net-zero emissions across its data center operations by 2030.
In addition to its U.S. campuses, NTT Global Data Centers recently announced the opening of data centers in Madrid, Navi Mumbai in India, and its largest data center in Indonesia in Jakarta. NTT Global Data Centers also has ongoing construction that will deliver new data centers in Germany, India, and Johannesburg later this year.
In the U.S., each campus is designed for multiple data centers, which allows customers who want contiguous space to easily add capacity in adjacent data halls or buildings. Here’s a look at the company’s US footprint:
In 2018 NTT Global (then known as RagingWire) launched its primary campus in Data Center Alley in Ashburn, shifting to greenfield construction, customized from the ground up to support the company’s vision for Internet-scale campuses.
The first building, VA3, is a 16 MW data center featuring a mix of vault designs from 2 megawatts to 6 megawatts of power capacity, as well as a large room for multi-tenant retail colocation. VA4 and VA5 are 32-megawatt buildings with expanded and standardized vaults, and VA6 will feature NTT’s new 36-megawatt design – two floors, with three 6-megawatt data halls on each floor.
At least three more data center buildings are planned for the Ashburn campus, totaling 224 megawatts of capacity. The Prince William campus will be 50 percent larger, providing a next phase of growth for NTT and its clients from 2024 forward.
Having capacity can provide an advantage, especially as customers seek accelerated delivery timelines to meet demand for cloud services.
“One of the things our client base has told us that they appreciate how we build ahead in our markets,” said Adams in a recent conversation with DCF.
